content:
The "Internet Tax Freedom Act Amendments Act of 2007" changes the moratorium on internet taxes to extend until 2014. States that currently tax internet access are grandfathered in. The Internet Tax Freedom Act is amended to define 'Internet access' for subsections (a) and (b) based on previous enactments. Exceptions apply until June 30, 2008, for taxes on Internet access related to telecommunications services. The Internet Tax Freedom Act Amendments Act of 2007 clarifies that taxes on telecommunications services related to Internet access are exempt until June 30, 2008, unless specific conditions are met. No legislative inference should be made from this subsection or related amendments. The Internet Tax Freedom Act Amendments Act of 2007 exempts taxes on telecommunications services related to Internet access until June 30, 2008, under certain conditions. SEC. 4. DEFINITIONS. Section 1105 of the Internet Tax Freedom Act is amended to clarify the definition of Internet access services, including the purchase, use, or sale of telecommunications to enable users to connect to the Internet. The definition of Internet access services under the Internet Tax Freedom Act is clarified to include services like home pages, electronic mail, instant messaging, video clips, and personal electronic storage. It does not cover voice, audio, or video programming that require a charge, regardless of how it is billed. The definition of Internet access services under the Internet Tax Freedom Act is clarified to include messaging, video clips, and personal electronic storage. Telecommunications services are defined in accordance with the Communications Act of 1934 and the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. Effective November 1, 2007, the term 'tax on Internet access' excludes State taxes specifically levied on commercial activity, modified gross receipts, taxable margin, or gross income of businesses using certain terms defined by State law. The term 'tax on Internet access' excludes certain State taxes enacted between June 20, 2005, and November 1, 2007, that replaced value-added or income-based taxes, are broad-based, and non-discriminatory towards communication service providers. The subparagraph allows states to modify certain taxes without limiting the range of business activities or disqualifying the tax. No legislative inference should be made regarding the application of certain taxes before November 1, 2007. SEC. 5 of the Internet Tax Freedom Act is amended to include changes related to telecommunications services and enabling users to access content over the Internet. Additionally, SEC. 6 addresses the sunset of grandfather provisions. SEC. 6 of the Internet Tax Freedom Act addresses the sunset of grandfather provisions, stating that certain states are exempt from taxes on Internet access if they have repealed such taxes more than 24 months prior to the enactment of this provision. SEC. 7 specifies that the Act and its amendments will take effect on November 1, 2007. The curr_chunk can be summarized as:
